slide.title: Instructor
slide.text: 2/46 instructor room: b215 or b512 office hours: wed 12:00pm-1:30pm email: hwdong.cn@gmail.com research area: graphics,vision,...

slide.title: What is Computer Graphics(CG)
slide.text: what is computer graphics(cg) imaging = representing 2d images modeling = representing 3d objects rendering = constructing 2d images from 3d models animation = simulating changes over time 3/46

slide.title: What is Computer Graphics(CG)
slide.text: what is computer graphics(cg) i. image processing ii. modeling iii. rendering iv. animation 4/46

slide.title: I: Image processing
slide.text:
i: image processing raster graphics display devices color models image representation sampling reconstruction quantization & aliasing image processing filtering warping composition morphing
5/46 放大图像可以看出，数字图像是由像素pixel构成的

slide.title: What will you learn in this class?
slide.titleNormalized: what will you learn in this class?
slide.text: 19/46 what will you learn in this class? 2d graphics drawing lines, polygons image processing 3d graphics transformations lighting ray tracing geometric modeling animation

slide.title: What you’re expected to know
slide.text:
20/46 what you’re expected to know programming experience c/c++ 精通c语言，c++了解更好 c++ primer, cplusplus reference and standard template library guide, google c++ style guide.
simple mathematics 线性代数（向量和矩阵），初等几何

slide.title: Assignments
slide.text: 21/46 assignments simple glut/opengl application scan conversion, clipping 2d transformation curve & surface modeling and view transform hidden surfaces, texture mapping and shadings ray tracing animation from mocap

slide.title: Samples of assignments
slide.text: 22/46 samples of assignments ray tracer animation with mocap

slide.title: More on Assignments
slide.text: 23/46 more on assignments turn in code in time code and win32 executable make your code readable (comment) you may discuss concepts, but coding is individual (no “team coding” )

slide.title: Grading

24/46 grading 50% assignments 20% attendance 30% final
may be changed, depends

slide.title: Introduction to OpenGL
slide.text: introduction to opengl • an application programming interface (api) • a low‐level graphics programming api – contains over 250 functions – developed by silicon graphics inc. (sgi) in 1992 – most recent version: 4.2, released on 08/08/2011 41/46

slide.title: Introduction to OpenGL
slide.text:
introduction to opengl what opengl is not no commands for windowing no commands for obtaining user input no commands for anything except drawing on the screen
44/46

slide.title: Introduction to OpenGL
slide.text: introduction to opengl 46/46

slide.title: OpenGL Command Formats
slide.notes: Gl specifies the opengl library Vertex is the name of the function that renders a 3D point (or a vertex) 3: is the number of parameters F is data type
slide.notesNormalized: gl specifies the opengl library vertex is the name of the function that renders a 3d point (or a vertex) 3: is the number of parameters f is data type
slide.notesHtml:
• Gl specifies the opengl library

• Vertex is the name of the function that renders a 3D point (or a vertex)

• 3: is the number of parameters

• F is data type
slide.text:
47/46 opengl command formats glvertex3fv( v ) number of components 2 - (x,y) 3 - (x,y,z) 4 - (x,y,z,w) data type b - byte ub - unsigned byte s - short us - unsigned short i - int ui - unsigned int f - float d - double vector omit “v” for scalar form
glvertex2f( x, y ) prefix initial capital letters

slide.title: A Smidgen of OpenGL Code
slide.notes: GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT is an OpenGL symbolic constant specifying that it is the bit values in the color buffer that are to be set to the value indicated in the glClearColor function. This statement clears the color buffer, so that the screen will start blank.
slide.notesNormalized: gl_color_buffer_bit is an opengl symbolic constant specifying that it is the bit values in the color buffer that are to be set to the value indicated in the glclearcolor function. this statement clears the color buffer, so that the screen will start blank.
slide.notesHtml:
• GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT is an OpenGL symbolic constant specifying that it is the bit values in the color buffer that are to be set to the value indicated in the glClearColor function.

• This statement clears the color buffer, so that the screen will start blank.

slide.title: OpenGL Geometric Primitives
slide.text: 57/46 opengl geometric primitives all geometric primitives are specified by vertices gl_quad_strip gl_polygon gl_triangle_strip gl_triangle_fan gl_points gl_lines gl_line_loop gl_line_strip gl_triangles gl_quads

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: Each vertex specifies a point.
slide.notesNormalized: each vertex specifies a point.
slide.notesHtml: • Each vertex specifies a point.

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: Each pair of vertices creates a line
slide.notesNormalized: each pair of vertices creates a line
slide.notesHtml: • Each pair of vertices creates a line

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: The first vertex specifies a starting point and every successive vertex creates a line from the previous vertex.
slide.notesNormalized: the first vertex specifies a starting point and every successive vertex creates a line from the previous vertex.
slide.notesHtml: • The first vertex specifies a starting point and every successive vertex creates a line from the previous vertex.

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: his is the same as the GL_LINE_STRIP except that the first and last vertices are also connected with a line.
slide.notesNormalized: his is the same as the gl_line_strip except that the first and last vertices are also connected with a line.
slide.notesHtml: • his is the same as the GL_LINE_STRIP except that the first and last vertices are also connected with a line.

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: N vertices can be placed to create an N sides polygon.
slide.notesNormalized: n vertices can be placed to create an n sides polygon.
slide.notesHtml: • N vertices can be placed to create an N sides polygon.

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: Each triplet of vertices forms a triangle.
slide.notesNormalized: each triplet of vertices forms a triangle.
slide.notesHtml: • Each triplet of vertices forms a triangle.

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: The first 3 vertices form a triangle. Every following vertex along with the previous 2 vertices is used to form another triangle.
slide.notesNormalized: the first 3 vertices form a triangle. every following vertex along with the previous 2 vertices is used to form another triangle.
slide.notesHtml: • The first 3 vertices form a triangle. Every following vertex along with the previous 2 vertices is used to form another triangle.

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: This first vertex specifies your main vertex. Every following pair of vertices are used along with the main vertex to form a triangle.
slide.notesNormalized: this first vertex specifies your main vertex. every following pair of vertices are used along with the main vertex to form a triangle.
slide.notesHtml: • This first vertex specifies your main vertex. Every following pair of vertices are used along with the main vertex to form a triangle.

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: Every 4 vertices form a quadrilateral
slide.notesNormalized: every 4 vertices form a quadrilateral
slide.notesHtml: • Every 4 vertices form a quadrilateral

slide.title: OpenGL Drawing Functions
slide.notes: The first 4 vertices form a quadrilateral. Every successive pair of vertices combine with the previous pair to form another quadrilateral
slide.notesNormalized: the first 4 vertices form a quadrilateral. every successive pair of vertices combine with the previous pair to form another quadrilateral
slide.notesHtml: • The first 4 vertices form a quadrilateral. Every successive pair of vertices combine with the previous pair to form another quadrilateral

slide.title: OpenGL-Related Libraries
slide.text: 68/46 opengl-related libraries glu (opengl utility library) - part of opengl - provides higher-level drawing routines such as spheres, nurbs, tessellators, quadric shapes, etc…

slide.title: OpenGL-Related Libraries
slide.text: 69/46 opengl-related libraries glu (opengl utility library) - part of opengl - provides higher-level drawing routines such as spheres, nurbs, tessellators, quadric shapes, etc… glut (opengl utility toolkit) - perform system-level i/o with the host operating system - cross platform - portable windowing api - not officially part of opengl

slide.title: GLUT: OpenGL Utility Toolkit
slide.text: 70/46 glut: opengl utility toolkit application structure configure and open window initialize opengl state register input callback functions render resize input: keyboard, mouse, etc. enter event processing loop

slide.title: Sample Program
GLUT Callback Functions回调函数
slide.notes: This specifies the function that needs to be called when the window is redrawn.
slide.notesNormalized: this specifies the function that needs to be called when the window is redrawn.
slide.notesHtml: • This specifies the function that needs to be called when the window is redrawn.

slide.title: OpenGL Initialization
Dispaly
include files and data
Prepare for using GLUT
slide.notes: http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=a7b7a05e-6de6-4d3a-a423-37bf0912db84&displaylang=en C:/program files/Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0/VC/include/gl C:/windows/system32
slide.notesNormalized: http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=a7b7a05e-6de6-4d3a-a423-37bf0912db84&displaylang=en c:/program files/microsoft visual studio 9.0/vc/include/gl c:/windows/system32
slide.notesHtml:
• http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=a7b7a05e-6de6-4d3a-a423-37bf0912db84&displaylang=en

• C:/program files/Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0/VC/include/gl

• C:/windows/system32
slide.text: prepare for using glut install microsoft visual c++ 2010-vc2010 get glut and install put “glut.h” in ../vc/include/gl put “glut32.lib” ../vc/lib put “glut32.dll” in ../windows/system32 vc setting: add text “glut32.lib opengl32.lib glu32.lib” in “object/library modules” of “link” tab in your program: #include <gl/glut.h>

slide.title: Assignment 1 Simple OpenGL/GLUT Application
slide.text:
78/46 assignment 1 simple opengl/glut application build a simple opengl/glut application designed to get you started using opengl and callbacks for interaction: such as using mouse to draw lines or polygons.
opengl @ lighthouse 3d - glut tutorial
